posts.author: blackfeltfedora
posts.content: I was fooling around with re-building the Kukri Saint as a dex-based Halfling and saw that I was eligible for Improved Whirlwind Attack. I've never seen a build that uses that feat but it appears quite useful, is there a reason I'm missing that feat has been underutilized?

posts.author: Orion
posts.content: Its an interesting question, I avoid building with it due to the expensive pre-requistes (21st level, intelligence 13+, dexterity 23+, dodge, expertise, mobility, spring attack, whirlwind attack), most of my weaponmasters end up strength based with Dex 13-16 at most but perhaps some of the others will have more to add, perhaps in a high magic environment where most of the damage comes from weapon enchantments rather than strength damage, might such a dex based weapon master shine, I tend to prefer low-mid magic (ie +5-6 max).

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Well, to be honest, Whirlwind Attack (and Improved Whirlwind Attack) have a lot of pre-requisites.

21st level, intelligence 13+, dexterity 23+, dodge, expertise, mobility, spring attack, whirlwind attack to be exact.

That's a lot of feats for...what, exactly?  One can attack once on each target (albeit with full AB).

So let us break this down for a minute.  I know it sounds great, in theory. 

Let us say one has 4 attacks a round (full BAB without haste, ITWF, etc - and since we are talking IWA, Epic levels, so 4 attacks round).

These are all concentrated on one opponent.  Should that opponent not survive the onslaught, Cleave (and Great Cleave) come into consideration.

So concentrating those 4 attacks on one opponent (and downing it) is more effective than damaging many opponents at once (even when threatening Dev Crits, assuming it is a Dev Crit build and having a really good crit range aka Kukris) - because Dev Crit does not always result in a dead opponent (no crit, save, ED, etc).

The reason for this is simple.  In a situation where one would want to use IWA (more than 1~2 opponents gathered around), as the opponents drop one by one from normal attacks concentrated on one opponent, that means there are less opponents to be attacked by.

This is more effective that spreading the damage among your opponents, as they are still alive and can attack, heal, etc.

Also, one cannot use KD, or Called Shot, PA, etc with IWA.  And no sneaks, either,

Don't get me wrong here - with the right build, it can be a powerful feat (threatening Dev Crit in a 10 foot radius on all opponents with a good crit range weapon, for example).  But when one has crit immune opponents, etc, it quickly becomes rather unappetizing as a combat feat.

In other words, it is a bit situational, and the feat cost is staggering for it.

I have done a lot of testing with WA (not IWA, because my results from WA were...meh).  It does protect one from flatfooted, sneaks, etc and that is beneficial, but I found that there was a small range of levels where it was useful (so between 2~3 attacks a round) but then concentrating attacks on one opponent just picks up and superceeds WA after that.

And then we come to the question of what about one opponent?  IWA is kind of absolutely useless against one opponent when stacked up against 4 attacks.  You know, that big Boss man that is waiting for you after you clean up his m0bs.

And then there is the case where if one has that much dex, one would most likely want to go ITWF - which costs feats as well (and results in a LOT of attacks/round!).  It is sort of at odds (or at least competing with) IWA. 

And in an environment where Haste is available, that sort of makes IWA a bit less desirable (especially when stacked up against ITWF!)

posts.author: blackfeltfedora
posts.content: To be clear I wasn't suggesting building a character to get this feat; Weaponmaster already has dodge, expertise, mobility, spring attack, whirlwind attack. Going for a finesse/dex based character already had me dumping all my stat points into Dexterity. Not being able to focus on the highest priority enemy can be an issue for sure, I was wondering if there was something inherently flawed with the feat (like Circle Kick). If you are in a situation with greater than 10 enemies surrounding you this could be helpful (dependent on dungeon layout, spawn points, and spawn rate vs kill speed). Dealing with a room full of sneaky Drow if you don't have sneak-immune could be helpful as well.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
There is nothing inherently flawed with either IWA OR Circle Kick.

Since BeamDog fixed CK, it works as advertised - I use it on my Deadly Nightshade build to great effect (being able to KD and/or Disarm twice a round is a handy thing).

It is a bit irritating when attack focus is broken, I will say that. 

IWA is just so feat intensive (yes, as WM one already has the pre-reqs) that spending one more feat for IWA - is really a lot of feats imo.
